A volcano erupts in downtown Los Angeles and a city official and a seismologist try to stop its inevitable flow through the city." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120461/","name":"Volcano","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2I2MTFiOWMtY2YzOC00MTZjLTg0NWUtMmZjZWJlZDYwZDZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A volcano erupts in downtown Los Angeles and a city official and a seismologist try to stop its inevitable flow through the city.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120461/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Joolz"},"dateCreated":"1999-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"complete and utter nonsense","reviewBody":"This film really is one of the most awful pieces of rubbish I have ever had the misfortune to sit through. The storyline itself is weak, the all-American back-slapping nonsense throughout left me feeling drained. Why? I laughed out loud at some of the ridiculous almost farcial plot situations...a volcano in LA?...hmmm. Every great actor has the right to make a turkey...Tommy boy, that was yours!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":74238,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1997-04-25","keywords":"la brea tar pits,lava bomb,firefighter,fire truck,1990s","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Volcano","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi836829465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGI3MjMzMWEtMTM1YS00NmM2LTk1YTEtNzVjYThhOTQzZmUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGI3MjMzMWEtMTM1YS00NmM2LTk1YTEtNzVjYThhOTQzZmUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000162/","name":"Anne Heche"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000451/","name":"Gaby Hoffmann"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0413875/","name":"Mick Jackson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0116435/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016278/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0035749/","name":"Jerome Armstrong"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712753/","name":"Billy Ray"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

Every great actor has the right to make a turkey...Tommy boy, that was yours!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":74238,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1997-04-25","keywords":"la brea tar pits,lava bomb,firefighter,fire truck,1990s","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Volcano","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi836829465","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGI3MjMzMWEtMTM1YS00NmM2LTk1YTEtNzVjYThhOTQzZmUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGI3MjMzMWEtMTM1YS00NmM2LTk1YTEtNzVjYThhOTQzZmUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000162/","name":"Anne Heche","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000451/","name":"Gaby Hoffmann"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0413875/","name":"Mick Jackson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0116435/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016278/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0035749/","name":"Jerome Armstrong","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712753/","name":"Billy Ray"],"duration":"PT1H44M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: I Still Believe
Wierzę w Ciebie
I Still Believe
programme.desc: I Still Believe: Directed by Andrew Erwin, Jon Erwin. With K.J. Apa, Britt Robertson, Nathan Parsons, Gary Sinise. The true-life story of Christian music star Jeremy Camp and his journey of love and loss that looks to prove there is always hope." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9779516/","name":"I Still Believe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTczOTM1ZGEtNzkyNS00NGRmLWI3YjEtZmRlOGZmMzgzNzU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjMxOTE0ODA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The true-life story of Christian music star Jeremy Camp and his journey of love and loss that looks to prove there is always hope.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9779516/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kelstra"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Real Tear Jerker","reviewBody":"I am a huge fan of Britt Robertson - mainly as a result of her performance in Mr Church. In spite of my regard for her however, I was a little reluctant to see this movie, due to its association as a religious movie. In the end my regard for Britt won over and I took the plunge. I need not have been concerned as the religious content was very subtle and was perfectly within the context of the story. This is easily Britt Robertson's best performance to date and the way she interacted with K.J.Apa was remarkable. You could really feel the bond between them which by all accounts was genuine and it showed in the excellent performances from both of them. This is a very moving film and anyone who doesn't shed a tear of two could only be made of stone. Beautifully shot and directed and interlaced with some really nice music. Definitely one of the better movies of recent times and highly recommended. My seven star rating might seem a little low in view of my approval but I am a harsh judge and my rating is very much in line with IMdB's. I guess everyone is aware that the movie is based on actual events. I have no idea how accurately it depicts them but it would seem that it hasn't strayed too far from the truth.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10204,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Biography","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2020-03-13","keywords":"liver cancer,singer songwriter,faith in god,love,religious film","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi615563033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWFiOGE5NWYtNTcxOC00ODZjLWFiZWQtMGQ3ZTFkNzk4OTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWFiOGE5NWYtNTcxOC00ODZjLWFiZWQtMGQ3ZTFkNzk4OTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The true life story of Christian music mega-star Jeremy Camp and his journey of love and loss."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6216001/","name":"K.J. programme.title: The East
Ida
programme.desc:
The East: Directed by Zal Batmanglij. With Brit Marling, Alexander Skarsgård, Elliot Page, Toby Kebbell. An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1869716/","name":"The East","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyNjQzMzg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjExNzU1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1869716/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Emma_Stewart"},"dateCreated":"2013-05-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"An outstanding addition to Brit Marling's repertoire","reviewBody":"Since 2011's Another Earth landed at Sundance and nabbed the Special Jury Prize, Brit Marling has quickly cemented herself as one of the most exciting and challenging new talents. When she feels a genre hasn't been explored to its full potential, she takes it further. When she notices women her age are typecast in boring roles, she writes her own. She's a visionary filmmaker with something to say and the talent and ambition to make sure she's heard - her second collaboration with director and co- writer Zal Batmanglij, The East, is no exception, and is perhaps the peak of her already illustrious career so far. 

The film follows Jane Owen (Marling), an undercover security agent, as she leaves behind her doting boyfriend (Jason Ritter) to infiltrate an eco-terrorist group known as The East, who have publicly targeted massive corporations for their covered-up crimes against humans and nature. In between reports to her icy, amoral boss (Patricia Clarkson), Jane slowly grows fascinated with the group, its morals and goals, and its core (Alexander Skarsgard, Ellen Page, Shiloh Fernandez, Toby Kebbell), observing with a mix of horror and infatuation as they execute their violent "jams" on the corporations' key members. 

The East will inevitably draw comparisons to Sean Durkin's Martha Marcy May Marlene because of the subject matter and its ingenue leading lady.The East is not as much of a psychological profile, but there are interesting similarities - like Durkin, Batmanglij and Marling never really villainize or condemn their subects; instead, they make a point of showing the East's appeal. We, the audience, begin to understand why these troubled young people would find solace and purpose in what is essentially a band of guerrilla terrorists, and, in turn, why Jane is so hypnotized by them. It makes for an uncomfortably provocative watch: as we learn more about the characters, their backgrounds, and the corporations' crimes (which are based in fact), it's hard to determine who the "bad guys" are. I saw the film at a festival where Batmanglij gave a short Q&A after and he revealed that he, Marling, and Page had lived with similar groups (without the terrorism) before and were sympathetic with the East's cause, if not their methods. The sympathy shows in the writing and most of the time that's a good thing, but there are times when it gets closer to bias and muddies otherwise brilliant storytelling - but these are blips in the overall outstanding product. 

Marling is, as always, enigmatic and hypnotizing, but she is an observer and lets the other characters do the talking; it takes highly skilled actors to command empathy for villains and the cast doesn't disappoint. Alexander Skarsgard is incredibly charismatic and persuasive, and he fills in the blanks admirably whenever his development is cut short. Patricia Clarkson surprises in an unusual role for her - she hints that her character might be more evil than any of the terrorists she is hunting. Jason Ritter and Hillary Baack are affecting in their small roles, and Julia Ormond dominates her five minutes of screen time - her last scene is perhaps the most haunting in the film. Ellen Page gives a career-best performances and reminds us that she's a force to be reckoned with if only she were given the chance to show off more often. She commands the screen with intimidating animosity from the second she walks on screen and has some genuinely heartbreaking moments later on. 

In spite of occasional misfires, the screenplay is exceptional especially in its efficiency: there is so much going on that there isn't much time to devote to individual characters or relationships - Marling and Ritter's suffers the most - but Marling and Batmanglij make every second count as each line is weighted with enough subtext to tell us the stories implicitly and thoroughly nevertheless. The major characters are very well-drawn; even though we only get glimpses into Skarsgard, Page and Kebbell's pasts, we feel we know them inside and out. The film moves along at a fluid, adrenaline-pumping pace and the tension is genuine and organic rather than forced - the audience's investment in the story grows from affection for the characters and connection with their ideals rather than cheap editing tricks, manipulative music and stylized lighting or sound. Music is used so sparsely that when The National's "About Today" plays over a silent montage of Marling's character breaking down, its emotional weight surprises and stuns. The ending is comparatively underwhelming, but the overall package is one of the best, most provocative thrillers in years and firmly establishes Batmanglij and Marling as a sensational and important pairing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49468,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-06-28","keywords":"anarchist,ecoterrorism,environmental crime,public sex,nude swimming","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2067179033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities irrevocably changed after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002907/","name":"Alexander Skarsgård"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0680983/","name":"Elliot Page"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074212/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Miasta rytm: Zrabowane dzieła sztuki
programme.desc: W trakcie II wojny światowej z Polski zniknęły setki tysięcy bezcennych dzieł sztuki. Zarówno niemieccy, jak i radzieccy okupanci masowo wywozili obrazy i rzeźby. Nie wszystkie udało się odzyskać. Obecnie wiele z tych polskich zbiorów rozsianych jest po całym świecie. Historyk sztuki Jerzy S. Majewski przybliża losy tych zrabowanych dóbr. Snuje opowieść o skradzionym dorobku wielu wspaniałych artystów i wyjaśnia, co się z nim dokładnie stało.

programme.title: Lato już było
Quel joli temps pour jouer ses vingt ans
programme.desc: 20-letnia Paloma (Lily-Rose Depp) traci dziadka. Cała jej rodzina spotyka się w noc przed jego pogrzebem w domu wypełnionym wspomnieniami z dzieciństwa. Dziewczyna musi skonfrontować się ze swoim żalem.

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

programme.title: Łapu-capu
programme.desc: Najśmieszniejsze fragmenty z programów polskich stacji telewizyjnych: gafy popełniane przez prezenterów, ich nietypowe zachowania przed kamerą oraz awarie techniczne powodujące absurdalne sytuacje.

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian
Noc w muzeum 2
Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian
programme.desc:
Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian: Directed by Shawn Levy. With Ben Stiller, Amy Adams, Owen Wilson, Hank Azaria. Security guard Larry Daley infiltrates the Smithsonian Institution in order to rescue Jedediah and Octavius, who have been shipped to the museum by mistake." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1078912/","name":"Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGZjZDE2NjUtMzVkNy00N2UyLTg5MjYtYzY1ZmM1YWY3ZTZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk1Njg5NTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Security guard Larry Daley infiltrates the Smithsonian Institution in order to rescue Jedediah and Octavius, who have been shipped to the museum by mistake.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1078912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bjohnt"},"dateCreated":"2009-05-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Exceeded my Expectations","reviewBody":"When I saw the trailer for this, I was pretty excited. I loved the whole premise of the first one, and having a sequel opened up whole new opportunities. I was excited when I saw all these famous characters from history being mashed together, Al Capone, Napoleon Bonaparte, Amelia Earhart, to name a few. 

I walked into the theater not expecting to much, but when I left I was very happy with it. They handled every characters personality beautifully, and the inside jokes were hilarious. I don't want to give much away, but trust me, you'll laugh. It tackles many themes like, a house divided cannot stand, the way to happiness is doing what you love, don't dwell on the past, etc. For a family flick they handle this jumbled cast of characters with complex personalities amazingly. They threw away most of the characters from the first movie to make way for the newer characters, which I didn't like that much, but how many characters can you throw in a story to have it make sense?

This film is an amazing example of a movie made for kids and adults. Kids will enjoy the silly humor, and the monkey. While adults will laugh at the onslaught of in-jokes, and trust me, there's a lot.

All in all, this was a great movie, blew me away. The highlight for me was Hank Azaria, that lisp kills me every time.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":185025,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2009-05-20","keywords":"al capone character,darth vader character,theodore roosevelt character,abraham lincoln character,albert einstein character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian -- Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1663697689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODE1MDI2NTk1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTAyNjkxMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODE1MDI2NTk1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTAyNjkxMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Security guard Larry Daley infiltrates the Smithsonian Institute in order to rescue Jedediah and Octavius, who have been shipped to the museum by mistake."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005562/","name":"Owen Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0010736/","name":"Amy Adams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506613/","name":"Shawn Levy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0158853/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0304830/","name":"Robert Ben Garant"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0502073/","name":"Thomas Lennon"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wielki interes z trampkami
programme.desc: Twórcy dokumentu zaglądają za kulisy potężnego rynku sneakersów, czyli butów zaprojektowanych na wzór obuwia sportowego, jednak przeznaczonych głównie do chodzenia na co dzień. Przyglądają się m.in. subkulturze sneakerheadów, czyli ich kolekcjonerów oraz ludziom, którzy kupują sneakersy znanej marki czy w limitowanej serii, by później z zyskiem je sprzedać. Sprawdzają też, jak narodził się szum wokół tych butów.

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
Szklana pułapka 4.0
Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc:
Live Free or Die Hard: Directed by Len Wiseman. With Bruce Willis, Timothy Olyphant, Justin Long, Maggie Q. John McClane and a young hacker join forces to take down master cyber-terrorist Thomas Gabriel in Washington D.C." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0337978/","name":"Live Free or Die Hard","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDQxMDE1OTg4NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTMzOTQzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"John McClane and a young hacker join forces to take down master cyber-terrorist Thomas Gabriel in Washington D.C.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0337978/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"paul_haakonsen"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bruce Willis is doing what he does best...","reviewBody":"Well, I must admit that I am rather impressed that the "Die Hard" franchise can remain this exciting and entertaining four movies into the franchise.

Initially I found the plot of the 2007 movie "Live Free or Die Hard" from writers Mark Bomback and David Marconi a bit off-putting, given the thematic cyberterrorism that the movie revolved around. But it grew on me and I came to like it as director Len Wiseman managed to put out a movie that was every bit up to speed with the previous three movies.

There is as much action and excitement in "Live Free or Die Hard" as there was in every previous installment in the franchise, so if you enjoyed any of the previous movies, you will also enjoy this 2007 movie.

"Live Free or Die Hard" had a pretty impressive cast. Of course you have action star Bruce Willis returning to the John McClane character. But the movie also have talents such as Justin Long, Maggie Q, Cliff Curtis and Timothy Olyphant on the cast list. I was thrilled to see that they cast Timothy Olyphant for the villain in "Live Free or Die Hard", however he just wasn't given as much material to work with as the previous villains did in the previous 3 movies, so his character came off as being less detailed and interesting actually, which was a shame, because Olyphant is a good actor.

The storyline in "Live Free or Die Hard" deviates somewhat from the formula used on the previous three movies, for better or worse. I guess this gamble from writers Mark Bomback and David Marconi is something that you either like or dislike. Personally, I enjoyed it, as it brought some freshness to the franchise, while it kept the essence of the franchise at heart.

My rating of "Live Free or Die Hard" lands on a 7 out of 10 stars, once the dust has settled.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":396217,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2007-06-27","keywords":"ford crown victoria,hacker,hacking,cyber terrorist,washington d.c.","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Live Free or Die Hard","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2534908953","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzMwYzEzY2EtOTQ0NS00YzQxLWE2NzctMTg3Njc5YzU1NzlmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzMwYzEzY2EtOTQ0NS00YzQxLWE2NzctMTg3Njc5YzU1NzlmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 2 for Live Free or Die Hard"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000246/","name":"Bruce Willis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0519043/","name":"Justin Long"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0648249/","name":"Timothy Olyphant"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0936482/","name":"Len Wiseman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136728/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1985343/","name":"John Carlin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0861636/","name":"Roderick Thorp"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0093560/","name":"Mark Bomback"}],"duration":"PT2H8M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kiss of Death
Pocałunek śmierci
Kiss of Death
programme.desc:
Kiss of Death: Directed by Barbet Schroeder. With David Caruso, Samuel L. Jackson, Nicolas Cage, Helen Hunt. A reformed convict goes undercover with the help of an angry detective to ensnare a psychotic mobster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113552/","name":"Kiss of Death","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmMwNmVkZDItY2UzNi00ZGE2LTlkOTUtNDNlOGJkZDNhYjVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDAxNjkxNjQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A reformed convict goes undercover with the help of an angry detective to ensnare a psychotic mobster.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113552/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"inspectors71"},"dateCreated":"2007-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Short of Breath","reviewBody":"Kiss of Death boasts an impressive cast, authentic locales, and a gritty, accessible storyline, but it still comes across as an asthmatic remake of the film noir classic. Nobody "stars" in KOD; rather, David Caruso, Helen Hunt, Nicholas Cage, Samuel L. Jackson, Ving Rhames, and Kathryn Erbe all put in good, workmanlike performances that just don't catch fire.

I enjoyed Kiss of Death ten years ago when I rented it. What made it enjoyable again was seeing people I had forgotten about--a young Hunt, commanding on screen, an obscure Jackson, Cage almost unrecognizable, and Caruso, long before he decided to trade in acting for the ridiculous posturing he does on the boneheaded CSI: Miami.

Yet, the movie never really jells. We know the story well so we expect something better to make KOD stand out. "Workmanlike" just isn't enough.

I'd still recommend it, though. The freshness of the talent might be enough for you. And Cage, ripped and psychotic is so different from his breezy action roles of the last half decade. 

You may find a gem here!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18652,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1995-04-21","keywords":"neo noir,witness protection,cocaine,undercover,tears","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Kiss of Death","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi313131289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGRjZjA2NTItYzZiMi00MmZkLThiNDAtMjMyYTVlNmVmYzAxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGRjZjA2NTItYzZiMi00MmZkLThiNDAtMjMyYTVlNmVmYzAxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000168/","name":"Samuel L. Nobody "stars" in KOD; rather, David Caruso, Helen Hunt, Nicholas Cage, Samuel L. Jackson, Ving Rhames, and Kathryn Erbe all put in good, workmanlike performances that just don't catch fire.

I enjoyed Kiss of Death ten years ago when I rented it. What made it enjoyable again was seeing people I had forgotten about--a young Hunt, commanding on screen, an obscure Jackson, Cage almost unrecognizable, and Caruso, long before he decided to trade in acting for the ridiculous posturing he does on the boneheaded CSI: Miami.

Yet, the movie never really jells. We know the story well so we expect something better to make KOD stand out. "Workmanlike" just isn't enough.

I'd still recommend it, though. The freshness of the talent might be enough for you. And Cage, ripped and psychotic is so different from his breezy action roles of the last half decade.

programme.desc: Najśmieszniejsze fragmenty z programów polskich stacji TV: gafy popełniane przez prezenterów, ich nietypowe zachowania przed kamerą oraz awarie techniczne powodujące absurdalne sytuacje.

programme.title: Wysoki Pressing
programme.desc: Prowadzony w lekkiej formule telewizji śniadaniowej program poświęcony piłce nożnej. Gospodarz wraz z gośćmi omówi najważniejsze boiskowe wydarzenia, nie zabraknie też wnikliwych analiz i gorących dyskusji. Prowadzącymi na zmianę będą Daria Kabała-Malarz i Michał Kołodziejczyk.

programme.title: Turbokozak
programme.desc: Bartosz Ignacik i Grzegorz Jędrzejewski w zabawnym teście sprawdzają umiejętności piłkarskie zawodników z Ekstraklasy. Czasem w programie pojawiają się reprezentanci innych dyscyplin i znane osoby.

programme.title: Piłka nożna: Liga angielska - podsumowanie sezonu 2020/21
programme.desc: Spotkania z osobami wykonującymi ciekawe zawody. Bohaterowie serii spędzają w ich towarzystwie dzień, podczas którego czekają ich różne zadania. Nowe doświadczenia skłaniają uczestników programu do refleksji nad życiem. Zyskują oni bodziec, by całkowicie odmienić swój los. Mogą też wrócić do dotychczasowej pracy.

programme.title: Zielona rewolucja Marty Dymek
programme.desc: Popularna blogerka Marta Dymek w każdym odcinku próbuje przekonać zaproszonego gościa do kuchni wegetariańskiej. Prowadząca pokaże, jak zastąpić potrawy mięsne ich jarskimi wariacjami.

programme.title: Ugotuj mi, mamo! 2
programme.desc: Iwona Zasuwa, autorka bloga Smakoterapia, zaskakuje pomysłowością dań dla dzieci. Gotuje w towarzystwie mam i ich pociech. Oprócz ciekawych pomysłów na potrawy przygotowywane z myślą o najmłodszych, gospodyni programu podzieli się także wieloma praktycznymi radami na temat tego co, jak i kiedy serwować swoim milusińskim. Ponadto eksperci wytłumaczą, dlaczego pewne produkty szkodzą, a inne mają zbawienny wpływ na zdrowie zarówno dzieci, jak i rodziców.

programme.title: David w Europie 4
programme.desc: Zapierające dech w piersiach krajobrazy w połączeniu z niezwykle bogatymi smakami lokalnych potraw. Prowadzący po raz kolejny zabierze widzów w niezwykłą podróż. W tej serii David Goboriaud odwiedzi kraje Półwyspu Bałkańskiego. Kucharz zawita m.in. do Słowenii, Chorwacji, Bośni i Hercegowiny oraz Czarnogóry. Odkryje nieznane wcześniej składniki potraw, m.in. tajemniczą rybę skorpion.

programme.title: David w Europie 4
programme.desc: Zapierające dech w piersiach krajobrazy w połączeniu z niezwykle bogatymi smakami lokalnych potraw. Prowadzący po raz kolejny zabierze widzów w niezwykłą podróż. W tej serii David Goboriaud odwiedzi kraje Półwyspu Bałkańskiego. Kucharz zawita m.in. do Słowenii, Chorwacji, Bośni i Hercegowiny oraz Czarnogóry. Odkryje nieznane wcześniej składniki potraw, m.in. tajemniczą rybę skorpion.

programme.title: Rośliny Karoliny
programme.desc: Karolina Kudłacik, miłośniczka roślinności i specjalistka w dziedzinie projektowania ogrodów, udowadnia, że w każdej przestrzeni można stworzyć coś wyjątkowego. Prowadząca uwielbia rzeczy używane.

programme.title: Rośliny Karoliny
programme.desc: Karolina Kudłacik, miłośniczka roślinności i specjalistka w dziedzinie projektowania ogrodów, udowadnia, że w każdej przestrzeni można stworzyć coś wyjątkowego. Prowadząca uwielbia rzeczy używane.

programme.title: Pogotowie remontowe Wieśka 2
programme.desc: Dla wielu ludzi już sama wizja remontu jest niezwykle stresująca. Obawy okazują się uzasadnione, gdy pracownicy niesprawdzonych firm remontowych wyrządzają niewybaczalne szkody. Drugi sezon programu, w którym ceniony specjalista budowlany, Wiesław Skiba, naprawi błędy popełnione przez niekompetentnych kolegów po fachu oraz podpowie widzom, jak samodzielnie uporać się z drobnymi usterkami.

programme.title: Tenis: Turniej WTA w Ostrawie
programme.desc: Opowieść o królowej Wielkiej Brytanii oraz członkach jej rodziny. Twórcy zgłębiają archiwalne materiały takie jak listy czy pamiętniki, które rzucają nowe światło m.in. na relacje Elżbiety II z premierami oraz jej mężem i pozostałymi Windsorami. Pokazany zostanie również dramat księżnej Diany.

programme.title: Tenis: Turniej WTA w Ostrawie
programme.desc: Opowieść o królowej Wielkiej Brytanii oraz członkach jej rodziny. Twórcy zgłębiają archiwalne materiały takie jak listy czy pamiętniki, które rzucają nowe światło m.in. na relacje Elżbiety II z premierami oraz jej mężem i pozostałymi Windsorami. Pokazany zostanie również dramat księżnej Diany.

programme.title: News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

Kołysanka
Chanson Douce
programme.desc:

When Myriam, the mother of two young children, decides--despite the reluctance of her husband--to resume her activity in a law firm, the couple starts looking for a nanny." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7600706/","name":"Chanson douce","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTlkYTg3ZTQtMDY0Yy00YWMyLWExOWYtMDE4MDFjZjIzNDJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc5OTQwMzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Myriam, the mother of two young children, decides--despite the reluctance of her husband--to resume her activity in a law firm, the couple starts looking for a nanny.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7600706/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-07-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Choose wisely","reviewBody":"I have to admit, when I read thriller I thought this was going to be over the top ... but overall that is something the movie can not be accused of. Yes there is a characer who takes things to far. But even small things are served in small bites for us to chew - no pun intended.

The central performance is amazing - and while I am still struggling with that end ... it still elevates the movie for me. Of course that can go either way for the viewers. Which by the way if you say you are using spoilers, I'd hope you would actually talk about something than being vague about it - like an open review - again no pun intended.

This creeps up on you for sure and while you may not agree with certain decision the characters take ... you can understand them. Empathy can be a great thing ... sometimes it is "wasted" on the wrong person. But how could you know that, right? programme.desc: Dziesięcioodcinkowy serial dokumentalny, który przybliża okoliczności, jakie towarzyszyły powstawaniu najsłynniejszych utworów wielkich artystów muzyki popularnej. Wśród nich znajdują się Madonna, Sting, Rod Steward czy Cher.

programme.title: The Banger Sisters
Siostrzyczki
The Banger Sisters
programme.desc:
The Banger Sisters: Directed by Bob Dolman. With Goldie Hawn, Susan Sarandon, Geoffrey Rush, Erika Christensen. Lavinia and Suzette, former rock groupies and best friends, reconnect after twenty years; one is still as wild as ever, while the other has adopted a more conservative lifestyle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0280460/","name":"The Banger Sisters","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjA1OTQxNGEtNTRjNi00MWIwLWEyZGYtNGRjOGEwNzE5OWU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lavinia and Suzette, former rock groupies and best friends, reconnect after twenty years; one is still as wild as ever, while the other has adopted a more conservative lifestyle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0280460/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"claudio_carvalho"},"dateCreated":"2007-01-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Some People Never Change, Others Repress","reviewBody":"In Los Angeles, when the bartender Suzette (Goldie Hawn) is fired from the club where she works, she decides to travel to Phoenix and visit her friend and also former groupie of twenty years ago Vinnie (Susan Sarandon) to borrow some money. While on the road, she runs out of gas and without any money, she accepts to bring the stressed loser writer Harry Plummer (Geoffrey Rush) and in return he would pay for the gasoline. When she meets her old friend, now Mrs. Lavinia Kingsley, she finds a very conservative and traditional housewife, married with the successful lawyer Raymond Kingsley (Robin Thomas) and mother of two complicated teenagers, Hanna and Ginger. Their interaction along a few days improves their lives.

"The Banger Sisters" has a good premise, that some people never change while others repress their feelings, but it is badly executed. The idea of how people change their behavior when raise a family could be deeply developed based on the past of the two "banger sisters", but the way the forgotten and unknown past of Vinnie is disclosed to her family is absolute shallow and without any purpose. I believe Bob Dolman was lazy or afraid to shift to a profound drama, and preferred the easiest and most superficial way to make the confrontation between two exaggerated sides: the one who lives in the past and the other that does not use her experience to improve her relationship with her daughters and husband. My vote is six.

IMDb data; ttnr: 0280460, Title: The Banger Sisters, --- Description: The Banger Sisters: Directed by Bob Dolman. With Goldie Hawn, Susan Sarandon, Geoffrey Rush, Erika Christensen. Lavinia and Suzette, former rock groupies and best friends, reconnect after twenty years; one is still as wild as ever, while the other has adopted a more conservative lifestyle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0280460/","name":"The Banger Sisters","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjA1OTQxNGEtNTRjNi00MWIwLWEyZGYtNGRjOGEwNzE5OWU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lavinia and Suzette, former rock groupies and best friends, reconnect after twenty years; one is still as wild as ever, while the other has adopted a more conservative lifestyle.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0280460/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"claudio_carvalho","dateCreated":"2007-01-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Some People Never Change, Others Repress","reviewBody":"In Los Angeles, when the bartender Suzette (Goldie Hawn) is fired from the club where she works, she decides to travel to Phoenix and visit her friend and also former groupie of twenty years ago Vinnie (Susan Sarandon) to borrow some money. While on the road, she runs out of gas and without any money, she accepts to bring the stressed loser writer Harry Plummer (Geoffrey Rush) and in return he would pay for the gasoline. When she meets her old friend, now Mrs. Lavinia Kingsley, she finds a very conservative and traditional housewife, married with the successful lawyer Raymond Kingsley (Robin Thomas) and mother of two complicated teenagers, Hanna and Ginger. Their interaction along a few days improves their lives.

"The Banger Sisters" has a good premise, that some people never change while others repress their feelings, but it is badly executed. The idea of how people change their behavior when raise a family could be deeply developed based on the past of the two "banger sisters", but the way the forgotten and unknown past of Vinnie is disclosed to her family is absolute shallow and without any purpose. I believe Bob Dolman was lazy or afraid to shift to a profound drama, and preferred the easiest and most superficial way to make the confrontation between two exaggerated sides: the one who lives in the past and the other that does not use her experience to improve her relationship with her daughters and husband. My vote is six.

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
Speed 2: Wyścig z czasem
Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc:
Speed 2: Cruise Control: Directed by Jan de Bont. With Sandra Bullock, Jason Patric, Willem Dafoe, Temuera Morrison. A computer hacker breaks into the computer system of the Seabourn Legend cruise liner and sets it speeding on a collision course into a gigantic oil tanker." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120179/","name":"Speed 2: Cruise Control","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTRlOTQ0MzItZjUwYi00MDkwLWIwYTctZTgyNGY3OGQwZWViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A computer hacker breaks into the computer system of the Seabourn Legend cruise liner and sets it speeding on a collision course into a gigantic oil tanker.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120179/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DoctorSkyTower"},"dateCreated":"1999-07-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"A MISERABLE EXPERIENCE....","reviewBody":"After seeing THE best action movie ever (Speed) I went to this expecting more of the same awesome action.

Instead I was physically sea sick! Sat through the entire thing feeling like I was at sea in a teacup (in the middle of a cyclone), made worse by the terrible acting (even Temuera Morrison wasn't up to par in this) and lame 'action scenes'. The baddie wasn't bad enough, his reasons for hijacking the ship was just plain dumb, and Keanu Reeves, where the heck was he?

 This whole flick was over-the-top-bad, trying waaaaay too hard to equal Speed One. But putting all the action on a cruise ship - a SMALL cruise ship at that? There was twice as much action in the elevator scene at the beginning of Speed One!

I found the gigantic tanker explosion, the ship crashing through the dock at the end TOO long and boring. By this time, however, the sea sickness had subsided (probably because the ship had already landed!) The ending would've been easier to bare if the characters hadn't said such dumb cliches....

 I think I should've stayed at home....","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":78474,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Crime"],"datePublished":"1997-10-30","keywords":"collision course,bomb,teenage girl,character repeating someone else's dialogue,hand grenade","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Speed 2: Cruise Control","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi830800153","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWFjMzQzN2QtOTUwYy00OTg4LTg5NDEtNTYzYzU3ZjEyYjIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWFjMzQzN2QtOTUwYy00OTg4LTg5NDEtNTYzYzU3ZjEyYjIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000113/","name":"Sandra Bullock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000574/","name":"Jason Patric"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000353/","name":"Willem Dafoe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000957/","name":"Jan de Bont"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007610/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003662/","name":"Graham Yost"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000957/","name":"Jan de Bont"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0566595/","name":"Randall McCormick"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Love, Weddings & Other Disasters
Miłość, ślub i inne nieszczęścia
Love, Weddings & Other Disasters
programme.desc:
Love, Weddings & Other Disasters: Directed by Dennis Dugan. With Maggie Grace, Diane Keaton, Jeremy Irons, Dennis Dugan. It is a multi-story romantic comedy about the people who work on weddings to create the perfect day for a loving couple - while their own relationships are outlandish, odd, crazy and far from perfect." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10235718/","name":"Love, Weddings & Other Disasters","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA5NzRjMDktMzc0My00NDdkLThlN2YtNDZiYjM3MGVkY2M4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"It is a multi-story romantic comedy about the people who work on weddings to create the perfect day for a loving couple - while their own relationships are outlandish, odd, crazy and far from perfect.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10235718/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ts-0000"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Why the hate?","reviewBody":"Was it perfect? Lol-Not at all.

However did have overall parts,that made it watchable.

Casting was decent,most of the storylines & cinematography too."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1451,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-12-04","keywords":"couple","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4041982233","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFjNTQxNGEtMjEzNS00ZjI1LTg1OTYtOTRlNmI0NzNkY2YwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFjNTQxNGEtMjEzNS00ZjI1LTg1OTYtOTRlNmI0NzNkY2YwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Maggie Grace (Taken) and Oscar® winners Diane Keaton and Jeremy Irons lead this warmhearted romantic comedy. With a couple’s impending wedding as the backdrop, Love, Weddings & Other Disasters weaves multiple storylines as it follows the search for love by a colorful group of characters including: an inexperienced wedding planner (Grace) nicknamed “The Wedding Trasher”; a fussy celebrity caterer (Irons); his blind date (Keaton); and a tour-bus guide (Andrew Bachelor) looking for his Cinderella. programme.title: Masz na imie Justine
Masz na imię Justine
programme.desc: Masz na imie Justine: Directed by Franco de Pena. With Anna Cieslak, Arno Frisch, Rafal Mackowiak, Mathieu Carrière. When Polish teenager Mariola is duped by her new boyfriend and sold to a sex-trafficking ring in Germany, she is faced with a choice: die along with her grandmother, or adopt to her new identity as an experienced call-girl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0479257/","name":"Masz na imie Justine","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ5MTQ0ODQ3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzkyODI5NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Polish teenager Mariola is duped by her new boyfriend and sold to a sex-trafficking ring in Germany, she is faced with a choice: die along with her grandmother, or adopt to her new identity as an experienced call-girl.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0479257/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rashmitharao"},"dateCreated":"2011-01-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's a great film, and an unforgettable experience","reviewBody":"The film has many messages to convey. Besides that, it stretches the viewer's ability to empathize with the central character. It tests the viewer's sense of humanity, sense of justice, and his/her levels of tolerance. The viewer is tortured, is made to think beyond his comfortable life, his family, his friends etc. and is forced to think and feel for girls like 'Justine', girls who are forced to forego their self-identities to live under the identity of 'Justine'. Justine symbolizes the millions of innocent girls born free, born to live normal lives but are kidnapped, trafficked, blackmailed and forced into prostitution. Such girls gradually lose the sense of self, lose the sense of identity, sense of being human and begin to believe that they deserve it, that this is what their destiny is, this is what they are made of. How is it justified? Why should such a thing happen to anyone? Is there an escape? Where is hope? Who am I? What am I? If I escape, who will I be? Though the film may not offer answers to these questions, but through the character of Pauline it raises these questions in an effectual manner in the viewer's hearts, making 'Your Name Is Justine' an unforgettable experience.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":473,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"genre":["Thriller"],"datePublished":"2006-05-10","keywords":"pig,slaughterhouse,toasting with a drink,drinking vodka,male female relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1752088/","name":"Anna Cieslak"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0295823/","name":"Arno Frisch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0533650/","name":"Rafal Mackowiak"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0210938/","name":"Franco de Pena"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0143581/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121022/","name":"Chris Burdza"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1268993/","name":"Tomasz Kepski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0210938/","name":"Franco de Pena"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0479257, Title: Masz na imie Justine, --- Description: Masz na imie Justine: Directed by Franco de Pena. With Anna Cieslak, Arno Frisch, Rafal Mackowiak, Mathieu Carrière. When Polish teenager Mariola is duped by her new boyfriend and sold to a sex-trafficking ring in Germany, she is faced with a choice: die along with her grandmother, or adopt to her new identity as an experienced call-girl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0479257/","name":"Masz na imie Justine","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ5MTQ0ODQ3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzkyODI5NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Polish teenager Mariola is duped by her new boyfriend and sold to a sex-trafficking ring in Germany, she is faced with a choice: die along with her grandmother, or adopt to her new identity as an experienced call-girl.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0479257/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"rashmitharao","dateCreated":"2011-01-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's a great film, and an unforgettable experience","reviewBody":"The film has many messages to convey. Besides that, it stretches the viewer's ability to empathize with the central character. It tests the viewer's sense of humanity, sense of justice, and his/her levels of tolerance. The viewer is tortured, is made to think beyond his comfortable life, his family, his friends etc. and is forced to think and feel for girls like 'Justine', girls who are forced to forego their self-identities to live under the identity of 'Justine'. Justine symbolizes the millions of innocent girls born free, born to live normal lives but are kidnapped, trafficked, blackmailed and forced into prostitution. Such girls gradually lose the sense of self, lose the sense of identity, sense of being human and begin to believe that they deserve it, that this is what their destiny is, this is what they are made of. How is it justified? Why should such a thing happen to anyone? Is there an escape? Where is hope? Who am I? What am I? If I escape, who will I be? Though the film may not offer answers to these questions, but through the character of Pauline it raises these questions in an effectual manner in the viewer's hearts, making 'Your Name Is Justine' an unforgettable experience.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":473,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"genre":["Thriller"],"datePublished":"2006-05-10","keywords":"pig,slaughterhouse,toasting with a drink,drinking vodka,male female relationship","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1752088/","name":"Anna Cieslak","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0295823/","name":"Arno Frisch","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0533650/","name":"Rafal Mackowiak"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0210938/","name":"Franco de Pena"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0143581/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054609/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121022/","name":"Chris Burdza","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1268993/","name":"Tomasz Kepski","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0210938/","name":"Franco de Pena"],"duration":"PT1H37M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jestem REN
Jestem REN
programme.desc: Jestem REN: Directed by Patricia Ryczko. With Marta Król, Marcin Sztabinski, Marieta Zukowska, Janusz Chabior. We meet a mother quietly obsessing over the sudden change in her family's life. Gradually we learn she is an android, and has suffered a glitch. The company puts her into therapy in order to assess the damage. She comes to see that her android self is her own fantasy. She begins to cooperate with the therapy, realizing she will be able to return to her family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11067160/","name":"Jestem REN","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFiNDYxZDQtYzZjOC00NmU5LTllYjEtZjc4MWFhZGRhZTllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzUwOTc4NjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"We meet a mother quietly obsessing over the sudden change in her family's life. Gradually we learn she is an android, and has suffered a glitch. The company puts her into therapy in order to assess the damage. She comes to see that h","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11067160/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fxflinn"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thought provoking parable of mental illness","reviewBody":"Caught this at the Boston Science Fiction Film Festival in Feb 2020. It's a tidy, well made film that draws you into a family battling the mental illness of the mother, who believes she is a sentient android who has malfunctioned. But maybe she is a human who has constructed an elaborate backstory to hide from the pain of being a person who cannot love and who cannot stop beating her on-the-cusp of manhood son. The material clues suggest we are in our time, not some future echoing the television series "Humans," but we are looking at the world through the eyes of the narrator, the mother, and she sees clues about her android origin everywhere. By the time the movie reaches its conclusion, you've been drawn into the madness, the uncertainty of what is human, what is programming, and profound discomfort for the mom and her interior life. The dedication at the end of the film makes it clear the filmmaker wanted to share his experience with his mother and her struggle. He succeeded. The intimate cinematography is a case study in how closeups and lighting can draw an audience into the interior life of the characters. The actors all do a fine job, particularly Marta Krol in the role of the mother and Marieta Zukowska as her peer, counterpart, alter ego or therapist -- when you are in psychosis, those around you play many roles.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":72,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-03-27","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2067989/","name":"Marta Król"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2029225/","name":"Marcin Sztabinski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2346424/","name":"Marieta Zukowska"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2253296/","name":"Patricia Ryczko"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0734708/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0767135/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0778711/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2253296/","name":"Patricia Ryczko"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

Speed 2: Cruise Control
Speed 2: Wyścig z czasem
Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc:
Speed 2: Cruise Control: Directed by Jan de Bont. With Sandra Bullock, Jason Patric, Willem Dafoe, Temuera Morrison. A computer hacker breaks into the computer system of the Seabourn Legend cruise liner and sets it speeding on a collision course into a gigantic oil tanker." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120179/","name":"Speed 2: Cruise Control","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTRlOTQ0MzItZjUwYi00MDkwLWIwYTctZTgyNGY3OGQwZWViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A computer hacker breaks into the computer system of the Seabourn Legend cruise liner and sets it speeding on a collision course into a gigantic oil tanker.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120179/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DoctorSkyTower"},"dateCreated":"1999-07-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"A MISERABLE EXPERIENCE....","reviewBody":"After seeing THE best action movie ever (Speed) I went to this expecting more of the same awesome action.

Instead I was physically sea sick! Sat through the entire thing feeling like I was at sea in a teacup (in the middle of a cyclone), made worse by the terrible acting (even Temuera Morrison wasn't up to par in this) and lame 'action scenes'. The baddie wasn't bad enough, his reasons for hijacking the ship was just plain dumb, and Keanu Reeves, where the heck was he?

 This whole flick was over-the-top-bad, trying waaaaay too hard to equal Speed One. But putting all the action on a cruise ship - a SMALL cruise ship at that? There was twice as much action in the elevator scene at the beginning of Speed One!

I found the gigantic tanker explosion, the ship crashing through the dock at the end TOO long and boring. By this time, however, the sea sickness had subsided (probably because the ship had already landed!) The ending would've been easier to bare if the characters hadn't said such dumb cliches....

 I think I should've stayed at home....","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":78474,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Crime"],"datePublished":"1997-10-30","keywords":"collision course,bomb,teenage girl,character repeating someone else's dialogue,hand grenade","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Speed 2: Cruise Control","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi830800153","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWFjMzQzN2QtOTUwYy00OTg4LTg5NDEtNTYzYzU3ZjEyYjIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWFjMzQzN2QtOTUwYy00OTg4LTg5NDEtNTYzYzU3ZjEyYjIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000113/","name":"Sandra Bullock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000574/","name":"Jason Patric"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000353/","name":"Willem Dafoe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000957/","name":"Jan de Bont"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007610/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003662/","name":"Graham Yost"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000957/","name":"Jan de Bont"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0566595/","name":"Randall McCormick"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The East
Ida
programme.desc:
The East: Directed by Zal Batmanglij. With Brit Marling, Alexander Skarsgård, Elliot Page, Toby Kebbell. An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1869716/","name":"The East","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyNjQzMzg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjExNzU1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1869716/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Emma_Stewart"},"dateCreated":"2013-05-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"An outstanding addition to Brit Marling's repertoire","reviewBody":"Since 2011's Another Earth landed at Sundance and nabbed the Special Jury Prize, Brit Marling has quickly cemented herself as one of the most exciting and challenging new talents. When she feels a genre hasn't been explored to its full potential, she takes it further. When she notices women her age are typecast in boring roles, she writes her own. She's a visionary filmmaker with something to say and the talent and ambition to make sure she's heard - her second collaboration with director and co- writer Zal Batmanglij, The East, is no exception, and is perhaps the peak of her already illustrious career so far. 

The film follows Jane Owen (Marling), an undercover security agent, as she leaves behind her doting boyfriend (Jason Ritter) to infiltrate an eco-terrorist group known as The East, who have publicly targeted massive corporations for their covered-up crimes against humans and nature. In between reports to her icy, amoral boss (Patricia Clarkson), Jane slowly grows fascinated with the group, its morals and goals, and its core (Alexander Skarsgard, Ellen Page, Shiloh Fernandez, Toby Kebbell), observing with a mix of horror and infatuation as they execute their violent "jams" on the corporations' key members. 

The East will inevitably draw comparisons to Sean Durkin's Martha Marcy May Marlene because of the subject matter and its ingenue leading lady.The East is not as much of a psychological profile, but there are interesting similarities - like Durkin, Batmanglij and Marling never really villainize or condemn their subects; instead, they make a point of showing the East's appeal. We, the audience, begin to understand why these troubled young people would find solace and purpose in what is essentially a band of guerrilla terrorists, and, in turn, why Jane is so hypnotized by them. It makes for an uncomfortably provocative watch: as we learn more about the characters, their backgrounds, and the corporations' crimes (which are based in fact), it's hard to determine who the "bad guys" are. I saw the film at a festival where Batmanglij gave a short Q&A after and he revealed that he, Marling, and Page had lived with similar groups (without the terrorism) before and were sympathetic with the East's cause, if not their methods. The sympathy shows in the writing and most of the time that's a good thing, but there are times when it gets closer to bias and muddies otherwise brilliant storytelling - but these are blips in the overall outstanding product. 

Marling is, as always, enigmatic and hypnotizing, but she is an observer and lets the other characters do the talking; it takes highly skilled actors to command empathy for villains and the cast doesn't disappoint. Alexander Skarsgard is incredibly charismatic and persuasive, and he fills in the blanks admirably whenever his development is cut short. Patricia Clarkson surprises in an unusual role for her - she hints that her character might be more evil than any of the terrorists she is hunting. Jason Ritter and Hillary Baack are affecting in their small roles, and Julia Ormond dominates her five minutes of screen time - her last scene is perhaps the most haunting in the film. Ellen Page gives a career-best performances and reminds us that she's a force to be reckoned with if only she were given the chance to show off more often. She commands the screen with intimidating animosity from the second she walks on screen and has some genuinely heartbreaking moments later on. 

In spite of occasional misfires, the screenplay is exceptional especially in its efficiency: there is so much going on that there isn't much time to devote to individual characters or relationships - Marling and Ritter's suffers the most - but Marling and Batmanglij make every second count as each line is weighted with enough subtext to tell us the stories implicitly and thoroughly nevertheless. The major characters are very well-drawn; even though we only get glimpses into Skarsgard, Page and Kebbell's pasts, we feel we know them inside and out. The film moves along at a fluid, adrenaline-pumping pace and the tension is genuine and organic rather than forced - the audience's investment in the story grows from affection for the characters and connection with their ideals rather than cheap editing tricks, manipulative music and stylized lighting or sound. Music is used so sparsely that when The National's "About Today" plays over a silent montage of Marling's character breaking down, its emotional weight surprises and stuns. The ending is comparatively underwhelming, but the overall package is one of the best, most provocative thrillers in years and firmly establishes Batmanglij and Marling as a sensational and important pairing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49468,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-06-28","keywords":"anarchist,ecoterrorism,environmental crime,public sex,nude swimming","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2067179033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities irrevocably changed after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002907/","name":"Alexander Skarsgård"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0680983/","name":"Elliot Page"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074212/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1869716, Title: The East, --- Description: The East: Directed by Zal Batmanglij. With Brit Marling, Alexander Skarsgård, Elliot Page, Toby Kebbell. An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1869716/","name":"The East","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyNjQzMzg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjExNzU1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1869716/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Emma_Stewart","dateCreated":"2013-05-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"An outstanding addition to Brit Marling's repertoire","reviewBody":"Since 2011's Another Earth landed at Sundance and nabbed the Special Jury Prize, Brit Marling has quickly cemented herself as one of the most exciting and challenging new talents. When she feels a genre hasn't been explored to its full potential, she takes it further. When she notices women her age are typecast in boring roles, she writes her own. She's a visionary filmmaker with something to say and the talent and ambition to make sure she's heard - her second collaboration with director and co- writer Zal Batmanglij, The East, is no exception, and is perhaps the peak of her already illustrious career so far. 

The film follows Jane Owen (Marling), an undercover security agent, as she leaves behind her doting boyfriend (Jason Ritter) to infiltrate an eco-terrorist group known as The East, who have publicly targeted massive corporations for their covered-up crimes against humans and nature. In between reports to her icy, amoral boss (Patricia Clarkson), Jane slowly grows fascinated with the group, its morals and goals, and its core (Alexander Skarsgard, Ellen Page, Shiloh Fernandez, Toby Kebbell), observing with a mix of horror and infatuation as they execute their violent "jams" on the corporations' key members. 

The East will inevitably draw comparisons to Sean Durkin's Martha Marcy May Marlene because of the subject matter and its ingenue leading lady.The East is not as much of a psychological profile, but there are interesting similarities - like Durkin, Batmanglij and Marling never really villainize or condemn their subects; instead, they make a point of showing the East's appeal. We, the audience, begin to understand why these troubled young people would find solace and purpose in what is essentially a band of guerrilla terrorists, and, in turn, why Jane is so hypnotized by them. It makes for an uncomfortably provocative watch: as we learn more about the characters, their backgrounds, and the corporations' crimes (which are based in fact), it's hard to determine who the "bad guys" are. I saw the film at a festival where Batmanglij gave a short Q&A after and he revealed that he, Marling, and Page had lived with similar groups (without the terrorism) before and were sympathetic with the East's cause, if not their methods. The sympathy shows in the writing and most of the time that's a good thing, but there are times when it gets closer to bias and muddies otherwise brilliant storytelling - but these are blips in the overall outstanding product. 

Marling is, as always, enigmatic and hypnotizing, but she is an observer and lets the other characters do the talking; it takes highly skilled actors to command empathy for villains and the cast doesn't disappoint. Alexander Skarsgard is incredibly charismatic and persuasive, and he fills in the blanks admirably whenever his development is cut short. Patricia Clarkson surprises in an unusual role for her - she hints that her character might be more evil than any of the terrorists she is hunting. Jason Ritter and Hillary Baack are affecting in their small roles, and Julia Ormond dominates her five minutes of screen time - her last scene is perhaps the most haunting in the film. Ellen Page gives a career-best performances and reminds us that she's a force to be reckoned with if only she were given the chance to show off more often. She commands the screen with intimidating animosity from the second she walks on screen and has some genuinely heartbreaking moments later on. 

In spite of occasional misfires, the screenplay is exceptional especially in its efficiency: there is so much going on that there isn't much time to devote to individual characters or relationships - Marling and Ritter's suffers the most - but Marling and Batmanglij make every second count as each line is weighted with enough subtext to tell us the stories implicitly and thoroughly nevertheless. The major characters are very well-drawn; even though we only get glimpses into Skarsgard, Page and Kebbell's pasts, we feel we know them inside and out. The film moves along at a fluid, adrenaline-pumping pace and the tension is genuine and organic rather than forced - the audience's investment in the story grows from affection for the characters and connection with their ideals rather than cheap editing tricks, manipulative music and stylized lighting or sound. Music is used so sparsely that when The National's "About Today" plays over a silent montage of Marling's character breaking down, its emotional weight surprises and stuns. The ending is comparatively underwhelming, but the overall package is one of the best, most provocative thrillers in years and firmly establishes Batmanglij and Marling as a sensational and important pairing.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49468,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-06-28","keywords":"anarchist,ecoterrorism,environmental crime,public sex,nude swimming","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2067179033","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities irrevocably changed after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations. ","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002907/","name":"Alexander Skarsgård","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0680983/","name":"Elliot Page"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074212/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling"],"duration":"PT1H56M"</script><metacontent="

The story of two men, educators of children and adolescents with autism." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8655470/","name":"Hors normes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDUzODgxOTktODllNi00ZDA5LWI3YjktYTk0MWIwOGZlYmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of two men, educators of children and adolescents with autism.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8655470/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"vinsond21"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"I wish everyone gets to see this special movie","reviewBody":"It is a shame that a meaningful film like this one is not promoted to get more people to watch it, because it contains many hard truths that need to be told, but at least the filmmakers don't ram the message down the viewer's throat the way some movies do. Vincent Cassel, always a dependable actor, is at his career-best here. He is ably supported by a competent cast led by Reda Kateb. I really wish everyone gets to see this special movie, but it is especially recommended for those who are caregivers.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7820,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-10-23","keywords":"autist,paris france,autism,autistic man,autistic teenager","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [English SUB]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1733017369","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmEzN2QyZDItMmRiYy00MGQ5LTg5NmMtMDEzMzY5ZWUyMWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmEzN2QyZDItMmRiYy00MGQ5LTg5NmMtMDEzMzY5ZWUyMWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001993/","name":"Vincent Cassel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3024530/","name":"Reda Kateb"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0898653/","name":"Hélène Vincent"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0619923/","name":"Olivier Nakache"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0865918/","name":"Éric Toledano"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0098808/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0387248/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0619923/","name":"Olivier Nakache"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0865918/","name":"Éric Toledano"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="
